results.title: Egypt: the Nile River kingdom
results.brief_description: Featuring close-up photography of the pyramids, the ancient city of Luxor, the Valley of the Kings, Tutankhamen’s tomb, as well as modern cities and towns, this film examines a country that was the first great power of the ancient world. The film illustrates how throughout the ages Egypt has depended greatly on the Nile River for water, for agriculture and for survival.

results.title: Egypt: the habit of civilisation
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television, Central Productions and ITV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Legacy”.
The civilisation of ancient Egypt was conservative in nature, drawing its optimistic base from the annual flooding of the Nile which brought sustenance to the nation. The unchanging stability of the cosmos was symbolised by divine kingship, centralised power and the massive buildings which represented that power. The many surrendered power to the few - a condition which still exists for the majority of people today. Similarly almost everyone today, shares the ancient Egyptians’ concern for life after death. Yet the conquests of Alexander, and the synthesis of cultures which followed, culminating in the dominance of Islam have done little to change these basic beliefs.

results.title: Egypt: Quest for Eternity
results.brief_description: The river Nile gave birth to one of history’s great civilisations. Through the centuries, the ancient Egyptians created and constructed the most glorious monuments the world has ever seen. Explore the great temples of Luxor and Karnak. Cross the Nile to the Land of the Dead and enter the elaborately decorated tombs where the kings and queens are buried. Join Egyptologists as they unravel and interpret the riddles of Egypt’s intriguing past.

results.title: Egypt: a new horizon
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Alfred Wagg Pictures
results.brief_description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.

results.title: Egypt and Turkey
results.brief_description: Visit Egypt ‘the gift of the Nile” with a recorded history of more than five thousand years and experience the antiquities of Egypt such as the Sphinx and Great Pyramid in Giza. Travel to Cairo with its contrast of most modern city in the Middle East, but also mirror to an ancient past in bazaars, antiquities and museums. Visit also Alexandria once ruled by Alexander the Great and Cleopatra. In Turkey, visit Istanbul and the Turquoise Coast. Istanbul spans two continents and has been the capital of three empires: Byzantine, Holy Roman and Ottoman. Walk through the city’s old sector to see the monuments of these cultures.

results.title: Egypt and the Nile
results.creator_credit: Donald G. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a picture of Egypt and the Nile Valley as seen against its historical background. Emphasises the importance of the Nile River in the whole pattern of Egyptian life. Includes scenes of an ancient temple to the sun god at Abu Simbel, the dam at Aswan, the delta of the Nile, the Suez Canal, and the cities of Asyut, Cairo, and Alexandria.

results.title: Egretta
results.brief_description: A life history of the four species of egrets commonly found in Australia, the white egret, the great egret, the white crane and the white heron.

results.title: Ego development: the core of a healthy personality(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur M Kaye and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the establishment of ego qualities and the setting and achievement of goals in very young children. Proper resolution of the conflict between biological, psychic, and societal demands leads to the establishment of a healthy ego

results.title: Eggs
results.brief_description: This film deals with the mass-production of eggs for commercial marketing, and illustrates the technological devices used to speed up the output of eggs per day. Correct feeding and care of the hens in the laying houses, the gathering of eggs from both open and trap nests, the cooling and automatic handling, grading, cleaning, and packing of the eggs for the market are studied.

results.title: Egghead's robot (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk, Australian Council for Children's Film and Television and Milo Lewis
results.brief_description: A very funny comedy about Paul “Egghead” Wentworth, the son of an inventor, who makes a look-alike robot to do his chores and replace him at sports. All goes well until the robot is named “cricketer of the year”, then blows a fuse in the compost heap! Written by Leif Saxon. Rated: G
